description:
The RDF segment defines the content of the row data segments (RDT) in the Tabular Data Response Message (TBR).  It is used in two ways:
 
- As an optional segment in the SPQ message (Stored Procedure Request) or the VQQ (Virtual Table Query) message, this segment can be used to limit the number of columns returned and to specify what column positions the fields occupy (where supported, these features can be used to override the defaults for the particular query).  If omitted, all fields defined for the query are returned in their default column order. 
- As a required segment on the tabular data response message (TBR), this segment defines the contents of the table row data (RDT) segments that follow.

fields.name: Number of Columns per Row
fields.description: This field specifies the number of data columns (and therefore the number of fields) contained within each row of returned data

fields.name: Column Description
fields.description:
Each repetition of this field consists of three components:
 
- The HL7 item number, which identifies the field occupying the column.  (Refer to Section 2.24.16.2, “Query/response format code  (ID)   00697,” for item numbering conventions). 
- The 2 or 3 character HL7 data type, as defined in Section 2.8, “Data types.” 
- The maximum width of the column, as dictated by the responding system.  (This may vary from the HL7defined maximum field length.)

fields.name: HL7 Item Number
fields.description: The HL7 item number, which identifies the field occupying the column.  (Refer to Section 2.8.30, “QIP - query input parameter list,” for item numbering conventions.)

fields.name: HL7 Date Type
fields.description: The two or three character HL7 data type, as defined in Section 2.8, “Data types"

fields.name: Maximum Column Width
fields.description: The maximum width of the column, as dictated by the responding system.  (This may vary from the HL7defined maximum field length.)
